hadiths.english_translation: Narrated from Amr ibn Shu'aib and Tawus: Muhammad reported from Ibn al-Mubarak, from Ibn Jurayj, from Khallad, from Nafi', from Ibn Umar that he disliked stipulating a substitute in exchange transactions, and Ibn Ishaq said: This is the Shami version.

reliabilityIssues: majhul - narrator identification uncertain

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ayub ibn Sulayman: Abd al-Hamid ibn Abi Uways narrated to me, from Sulayman ibn Bilal, from Amr ibn Yahya, from Khallad ibn Khallad ibn Khallad: We prayed the Dhuhr prayer with Umar ibn Abd al-Aziz, then we entered to Anas ibn Malik and found him standing in prayer. We said: We have just prayed the Dhuhr. He said: I saw the Prophet ﷺ pray it thus, so I will never abandon it. And Muhammad ibn Ubaydullah said: Abd al-Aziz ibn Muhammad narrated to us, from Amr ibn Yahya, from Khalid ibn Khallad like it. And Khalid ibn Abdullah, and Muhammad ibn Fulaih narified him, and Khalid ibn Khallad is more sound.

hadiths.english_translation: From Sa'id ibn al-Musayyab and from Shaqiq ibn Thur, Ma'mar and Qasim ibn Fiyad narrated from them. Ahmad said from Abd al-Razzaq, from Ma'mar: I have not seen anyone in Sana'a except that he practices thubbaj (a form of sexual misconduct) except Khallad ibn Abd al-Rahman. Abd al-Razzaq said: He is from the (freed) slaves.

hadiths.english_translation: Heard from Amir ibn Abd al-Rahman and Khalid ibn Abi Imran, Abdullah ibn Wahb and Amr ibn Khalid narrated from them. Hassan al-Wasiti said from Khallad ibn Sulayman that he asked Ibn Umar. Then I said: Nafi' narrated to me. Then I said: I do not establish it from him. He said: We went out and did not know which faction was our leader or our camp. He said: The faction is the Messenger of Allah. I said: Allah says: O you who have believed, when you meet those who disbelieve. He said: It was revealed concerning the people of Badr, not before it nor after it. And he heard Abu Sa'd from Abu Hurayrah, he is counted among the Basrians. Muhammad ibn Abd al-Rahim narrated to us. He said: Mansur ibn Salamah narrated to us. Khallad ibn Salamah said: He is al-Hadrami. We were near Khalid ibn Abi Imran. He said: Nafi' ibn Abi Nafi' narrated to me, he is the son of Umm Nafi', his kunya is Abu Abdullah, from Umar.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ahmad: Abu Kurayb narrated to us, Khallad ibn Yazid al-Ju'fi narrated to us, from Zuhayr ibn Mu'awiyah, from Hisham ibn Urwah, from his father, from Aisha that she carried Zamzam water in bottles, and she said: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ carried it in waterskins and leather bottles, and he used to pour it on the sick and give them to drink. Abu Abdullah (Ahmad) said: It is not followed/supported (on this chain).

hadiths.english_translation: It is said: From Ali, Abu Dhuyan, Ja'far ibn Maymun narrated from him. Adam said: Shu'bah narrated to us, heard Abu Dhuyan, heard Abdullah ibn al-Zubayr, heard Umar, from the Prophet ﷺ, he said: "Whoever wears silk in this world will not wear it in the Hereafter." Ali ibn al-Ja'd narrated to us, he said: Shu'bah narrated to us, from Abu Dhuyan and Muhammad. Ibn Abi Adi narrated to us, Shu'bah narrated to us, from Abu Dhuyan.

hadiths.english_translation: Heard Nafi', Abu Amir al-Aqdi and Musa ibn Ismail narrated from him, he is counted among the Basrians. Abidah, Abd al-Samad narrated to us. He said: Khalifah ibn Ghalib al-Lithi narrated to us.

hadiths.english_translation: Heard Amr ibn Shu'aib, grandfather of Shabab. Waki' and Amr ibn Mansur heard from him. Muslim said: Khalifah Abu Hubayrah al-Lithi narrated to us.
